summary: This bill, the Helping Increase Realtime Employment for Communities Recovering from Emergency Disasters for an Interim Time Act (HIRE CREDIT Act), amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow the work opportunity tax credit for employers who hire individuals displaced by a qualified disaster. It defines "displaced disaster victim," specifies eligibility criteria related to residency and employment in the disaster zone, and sets a timeframe for hiring. It defines a qualified disaster and the incident period, as determined by FEMA and the President, with an effective date of January 1, 2024.
